Cypher TO THE SECRETARY OF STATE FOR THE COLONIES FILE COF PROM AD5H (Sir R* Champion) D. 25fch May, 1946, R. 25th ” « ' 16,30 IMPORTANT No,209 Secret, JN D i Addressed Ambassador, Cairo, NOv2o>^ (?Repeated omitted) S. of S. n British Middle gast office. Cairo,No*27» Yemeni situation, 1- I learn that a special emissary of the imam called Ahmed Taber ?Rajab is proceeding to Egypt immediately, accompanied by All Muhammad Jebali and carrying secret letter to King parouk asking him to select ‘♦at any salary* the best possible man to be the Imam's Foreign Minister, This means supersession of Ragheb Bsyo 2, it would be most helpful if a reasonably moderate wise man is being sent (corrupt group) and I hope it may be possible for you to drop a hint to that effect, if the opportunity offers, 3. Ahmed Teher reports that the imam T s position is not at all strong and that Sanaa ia not too friendly to him. This in itself ia a good enough reason for the imanfs continuance in Taxs. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 3; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a telegram from Sir Reginald Champion, Governor of Aden, to the British Embassy in Cairo regarding Ahmad bin Yahya, Imam of Yemen. It includes a reference to a request by the Imam to King Farouk of Egypt for assistance in selecting a new Foreign Minister.
